intro: Cnestis gabunensis, commonly known as the Gabon starling or African starling, is a flowering plant native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Cnestis gabunensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
